instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Crash unigine Heaven bench
threads.message:
Fixed <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> on this one. Ran Heaven to test, but this crashes and OSx returns to lockscreen shortly after. The fans run high after a while (without running Heaven), with low temperatures in iStats. ASD doesn't work, not sure why: 1) EFI version claims I'm using the wrong version (3S150) 2) Internet version produces a '...cannot load EFI/Drivers/TestSupport.efi' error.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Crash unigine Heaven bench
threads.message:
"ASD doesn't work"
Try disconnecting internal SSD.
3S150 should work on this board, but you can try 3S155 too.
Install gfxcardstatus and test machine with iGPU only.
See if problems appear only under discrete GPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Crash unigine Heaven bench
threads.message:
Thanks!

Both ASD's don't work. (tested without SSD) Google tells me more people have experienced this issue after a firmware update.

gfxcardstatus won't let me change to integrated and stays on dedicated, no matter how many times I click. Sounds like a mux problem to me. I'll try if replacing the mux changes anything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Crash unigine Heaven bench
threads.message:
I heard someone new gfxcardstatus doesn't switch as expected.
Try to find an older version...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Crash unigine Heaven bench
threads.message:
Tried that, and seems to work fine on iGPU. Although gfxcardstatus still has some trouble switching cards sometimes. I'm giving up on this one, it's either going to be GPU or memory I think.
Thanks anyway!
